verses.text: 亞當和他的妻子夏娃同房，夏娃就懷孕，生了該隱，就說：「藉著耶和華的幫助，我得了一個男兒。」

words.note: Euphemism for sexual intercourse.

verses.text: 她又生了該隱的弟弟亞伯。亞伯是牧羊的，該隱是種地的。

words.note: Indicates a person associated with the preceding verb/noun.
Indicates a person associated with the preceding verb/noun.

verses.text: 有一天，該隱把地裡的出產拿來，當作禮物獻給耶和華。

words.note: Used to mark the direct object when it's disposed of or acted upon.

words.definition: in the ground, from the land

verses.text: 亞伯也把自己羊群中一些頭生的，和羊的脂油拿來獻上。耶和華看中了亞伯和他的禮物；

words.note: Used to mark the direct object when it's disposed of or acted upon.
Here, it nominalizes 'firstborn' to mean 'the firstborn ones'.
Specific term for animal fat, especially in sacrifices.
To choose or approve; to take a fancy to.

verses.text: 只是沒有看中該隱和他的禮物。該隱就非常忿怒，垂頭喪氣。

words.note: To choose or approve; to take a fancy to.
An idiom meaning 'to be in low spirits'.

verses.text: 耶和華對該隱說：「你為甚麼忿怒呢？你為甚麼垂頭喪氣呢？

words.note: Lit. 'droop head, lose spirit'.

verses.text: 你若行得好，豈不可以抬起頭來嗎？你若行得不好，罪就伏在門口了；它要纏住你，你卻要制伏它。」

words.note: Used for rhetorical questions.
Indicates lifting one's head in honor/confidence.

words.definition: to crouch, to lie in wait
words.note: Implies 'lurking' here.

verses.text: 該隱對他的弟弟亞伯說﹕「我們到田間去吧。」（《馬索拉文本》缺「我們到田間去吧」一句，現參照其他抄本及古譯本補上。）該隱就起來襲擊他的弟弟亞伯，把他殺了。
耶和華問該隱：「你的弟弟亞伯在哪裡？」他回答：「我不知道；難道我是看守我弟弟的嗎？」

words.note: Emphasizes a rhetorical question, often implying incredulity.

verses.text: 耶和華說：「你作了甚麼事呢？你弟弟的血有聲音從地裡向我呼叫。

words.definition: to cry out, to call out

verses.text: 地開了口，從你手裡接受了你弟弟的血，現在你要從這地受咒詛。

words.note: A compound word meaning 'curse'.

verses.text: 你種地，地也不再給你效力；你必在地上流離失所。」

words.note: Verb-object compound: 'plant' + 'land'.
Here, refers to the land yielding its strength/produce.
An idiom meaning to be displaced and homeless.

verses.text: 該隱對耶和華說：「我的刑罰太重，過於我所能擔當。

words.note: Refers to legal or divine punishment.
A grammatical particle forming a nominal phrase with a verb.

verses.text: 看哪，今日你趕逐我離開這地，以致我要躲避你的面；我必在地上流離失所，遇見我的，都要殺我。」

words.note: Used to draw attention, similar to 'lo!' in older English.
Literary or formal term for 'today'.
A formal term for expelling someone.
Often used metaphorically for 'presence' in biblical contexts.
An idiom meaning to be displaced and homeless.
Used to nominalize the preceding verb phrase.

verses.text: 耶和華對該隱說：「絕不會這樣，殺該隱的，必遭報七倍。」耶和華就給該隱立了一個記號，免得遇見他的人擊殺他。

words.note: Used to nominalize the preceding verb-object phrase.
A formal term for suffering negative consequences.
Refers to a distinguishing mark or token.
Indicates preventing an undesirable outcome.
A formal term for killing by striking.

verses.text: 於是該隱從耶和華面前出去，住在伊甸東邊的挪得地。
該隱和妻子同房，她就懷孕，生了以諾。該隱建造了一座城，就按著他兒子的名，給那城叫作以諾。

words.note: A repetition in the original text of this verse.
Lit. 'same room'; a euphemism for sexual intimacy.
Used in the structure '給 (someone) 叫作 (name)' to name someone.

verses.heading: The Beginning of Civilization

verses.text: 以諾生以拿，以拿生米戶雅利，米戶雅利生瑪土撒利，瑪土撒利生拉麥。
拉麥娶了兩個妻子，一個名叫亞大，另一個名叫洗拉。
亞大生雅八，雅八就是居住帳棚、牧養牲畜的人的鼻祖。

words.note: Often used in agricultural or religious contexts ('shepherding').
Lit. 'first ancestor'.

verses.text: 雅八的兄弟名叫猶八；猶八是所有彈琴吹簫的人的鼻祖。

words.note: Literally 'nose ancestor', referring to the first ancestor.

verses.text: 洗拉也生了土八．該隱，就是打造各種銅鐵器具的匠人；土八．該隱的妹妹是拿瑪。
拉麥對他的兩個妻子說：「亞大和洗拉，要聽我的聲音；拉麥的妻子，聆聽我的話：壯年人傷我，我必殺他；青年人損我，我必害他；

words.note: 壯年 (zhuàngnián) refers to the prime of one's life.

verses.text: 人若殺該隱，要遭報七倍；人若殺拉麥，必遭報七十七倍！」
亞當又和妻子同房，她就生了一個兒子，給他起名叫塞特，因為她說：「 神給我立了另一個後裔代替亞伯，因為該隱殺了他。」

words.note: A biblical euphemism for sexual relations.
Functions as a compound verb meaning 'to name someone'.
The empty space before '神' (God) is a common convention in Chinese Bibles to show reverence.

verses.text: 塞特也生了一個兒子，就給他起名叫以挪士。那時人才開始呼求耶和華的名。

words.note: Indicates completion of an action.
Commonly used for people or general items.
A common biblical phrase for 'to name someone X'.
Implies a condition must be met first.
Often used in the Bible for calling on God.
The personal name of God in the Old Testament.
In biblical context, 'name' often signifies character or authority.
